message.content:
cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CE 

This paper deals with the problem of task allocation in a crowdsourced delivery platform, which involves assigning tasks to workers in a fair and efficient manner. This problem is related to several sub-fields of computer science, including multi-agent systems (cs.MA), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), social and information networks (cs.SI), and computer engineering (cs.CE). The paper proposes a new algorithm for task allocation that takes into account both fairness and task completion ratio, which suggests a focus on multi-agent systems and artificial intelligence. The evaluation of the algorithm involves running time and assignment ratio, which are related to data structures and algorithms and computer engineering. Finally, the problem of task allocation in a crowdsourced delivery platform involves social and information networks, as it involves the interaction between workers and tasks.
